title: What are the best free learning sites? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’ve been learning online for years now, so I believe I can share a useful list of resources. Khan AcademyI LOVE this one. It’s mostly recommended as a learning resource for elementary and high-school students. I’m an adult and I use it all the time. Whenever I want to learn the basics of something that I don’t understand, it’s my go-to resource. CourseraIt’s a classic in the eLearning industry. This website has some of the most serious university-level courses I’ve seen. The lessons are amazing, and the platform works well in connecting you with the lecturers and peers. From physics to mindfulness, you can learn anything here. LinkedIn LearningThis is not exactly a free learning platform, but you get a free month. That’s enough time for you to go through several courses if you’re committed enough. I love LinkedIn learning, since it’s committed to boosting your professional skills. It targets you with career-relevant courses. iTunes UIf you’re using an iPad or an iPhone, you already have a great resource installed. For example, Stanford University offers 20 video tracks in the course “How to Start a Startup.” Yale University offers an amazing “Introduction to Psychology” course. You can access plenty of high-quality learning materials without any fees at all. Academic EarthBerkeley, Stanford, MIT, and many other prominent universities feature courses on this platform. There are courses in chemistry, biology, math, business, healthcare, sociology, and many other niches.

If you are a CS/IT student and want to learn and upgrade your skills through an online platform, there are vast amount of resources available over the internet but you have to choose wisely by not wasting time on least useful resources. These days you can track your progress too , yes, this facility is available on many platforms where you can actually find out where you stand in the crowd. Determine your field of interest and if not able to, you may take up a skill test in order to check your interest in skills. The skill test includes a MCQ quiz round where questions are asked regarding certain skills. this enable the individuals to test their interest in a particular field. Some useful points may be: Practice Coding as much as you can on HackerRank, LeetCode, CodeChef, HackerEarth.Stay updated regarding any internship opportunity or hackathons and participate as much as you can.For this you may join any community such as LinkedIn, Freelancer, Up work. Indeed.Try to inculcate yourself in more and more projects building that will enhance your portfolio as well.Do not focus on getting plenty of certificates try to learn and develop skills instead. Having plenty of certificates will do no good if have no regarding knowledge.Participate and keep a check on events like Google Summer of code(Gsoc).Some of the useful sites which I have used in my college days are: Codeacademy: Codecademy is a website dedicated specifically to teaching coding. Codecademy teaches you how to write the code necessary to develop interactive websites using the most useful languages – HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, Python, Ruby, and PHP – and does it within the browser using interactive tools.MIT OpenCourseWare : It is a treasure trove of course material from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology; it provides lectures, lecture notes, homework assignments, sample tests and many other materials from the actual courses at MIT.Udemy: Udemy is an online institution that offers courses taught by leading experts. Udemy’s free courses are similar in concept to Coursera’s but additionally allows users to build custom courses from lessons. Working with many top professors and schools, the site mixes the customized platform of other sites with a heavy emphasis on top quality content. This is another site however, that mixes free and paid content.KhanAcademy: Khan Academy offers a useable, well organized interface and Also curate many courses from around the web. Khan Academy offers impressive depth on many different subjects. The lectures are short and share a handful of information at a time, but build on each other as you progress.Coursera: Coursera | Build Skills with Online Courses from Top Institutions is one of the leading providers of MOOCs – massive open online courses. It is a website that partners with universities and organizations around the world to bring a wide variety of topics and perspectives to one searchable database. This gives the site an extremely wide range of in-depth courses.Keep a check on yourself and explore yourself as much as you can. Don’t be so harsh and stressed on yourselves. Good things take time. HAPPY LEARNING!
